Ask HN: How to Write More Efficiently
text:
Happy new year HN!

I write a blog[1]. I have many ideas for posts. I enjoy the process of writing, no matter how much time it takes.

But the moment I stop writing, and start editing, I feel like the entire process takes forever. English is not my native language, and so I have to re-read the entire post multiple times, sometimes on two consecutive days, to let my eyes, and brain rest. And even though I'm able to catch some errors, and I use an online grammar checker-I still miss many silly mistakes like "is"/"in", "then"/"than", etc.

And this process of editing, re-reading, editing again, etc-drives me crazy. I know that I can pay an editor/proofreader to do that work for me, but I don't write professionally, and not yet ready to commit for a human editor.

I was wondering, maybe the writers among you have some tips on have I can write and edit more efficiently?

Thanks!

[1] https://www.yieldcode.blog/

From a Paramedic, Bill Kelleher (tried to tag). I don’t personally know anything about this topic but I wanted to share:

I'm familiar with commotio cordis as a paramedic for over 32 years. I've been teaching for 30 of those years including topics like kinematics of trauma, anatomy and physiology, etc.

CC is exceedingly rare, with fewer than 30 cases per year in the US, almost exclusively in teens (mean age of 15), and almost exclusively in sports with a fast moving, relatively small projectil
